website_summaries.verdict: If you own a Russian, Greek, sulcata, leopard, or pancake tortoise, this fiber-packed, low-protein, and all-around tasty pellet meal is a complete diet custom-tailored to provide the optimum levels of nutrition for your tortoise.
pros: Timothy hay, wheat, almond hull meal, miscanthus grass, and sun-cured alfalfa meal are the first 5 ingredients
Tortoises love the flavors of dandelion greens, alfalfa, and ginger extract
cons: A particularly expensive tortoise diet, but it is specially formulated for the dietary needs of certain species

customer_reviews.title: IM A TORTOISE AND LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: Hello, my name is Morty. I am a tortoise and I'm dictating this review to my human companion. Firstly I must admit I was hesitant to eat this product. At first glance it appeared different from most grasses I'm used to. But the smell! It smelled so good I knew I had to try it, or at least lay on it for a while. One bite and I was hooked! This food is remarkable after it's been soaked in warm water (just like me) and when you've had your fill you can lay on top of it. Would highly recommend to any tortoise!
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Desert tortoise loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My desert tortoise loves this stuff! I usually put some in the Vitamix with some dark leafy greens or cactus and some water and mix it all up. I make a few days worth. I give my desert tortoise a big scoop of it, and she eats it all up. I will keep buying this. My Russian tortoise, on the other hand, turns his nose up at this stuff. He is a very picky eater, and I was hoping he would like it too, but no such luck.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: My radiated tortoise just won't eat them.
customer_reviews.text: My tortoise are eating mostly garden salad, hibiscus leaves, dandalion leaves, etc. I also give them rep-cal tortoise pellet. Recently I want to switch them to more healthy alternative like this one, but after days of trying and trying just not working. I mixed their usual food, but any piece of food that they taste grassland, they spitted out. I really don't understand and know why? I even tried mix some fruit juice, but still not working. It's really frustrating. I know this is a very good product from the ingredient.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: My picky yellow foot eats it - I love that it doesn't contain artificial ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I typically feed a variety of freshies but give her something pelleted when I don't feel like "cooking". She will not eat straight up hay. She's about 6 years old now and I started purchasing this product when she was 3yo. Switched from the repcal pellets due to the added artificial coloring. Had experience using mazuri with reptiles before but preferred ZooMeds "natural tortoise food" due to ingredients and being slightly cheaper. At first she had no interest (I believe due to the color) and I had to mix in small chopped up pieces of strawberries the first couple times it was offered. She eats it without doctoring it now and finishes the plate.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: like others have said
customer_reviews.text: our tortoise has eaten Zoo Med . I figured I'd save a few bucks and buy it large on amazon. like others have said, my tortoise (who eats this all the time) flat out refuses anything so much as mixed with this container's product. they must have mixed spoiled or tainted greens because our little one normally gobbles up this staple product for over 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: jmitch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Russian  Tortoise loves it
customer_reviews.text: I struggled at first with knowing how to moisten the product up into a mash. Then I accidentally left it soaking for a half an hour and the product soaked itself. Now I leave four or five pellets soaking in a small amount of water for about 10 minutes, and the pellets soften themselves into a moist mash. My Russian Tortoise loves it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great if you’re a tortoise
customer_reviews.text: Tortoise eats it fine. Doesnt stink. It takes a little getting used to but they will get hungry eventually and eat it. Its easiest to dump 4/5 days worth into a sealable plastic container, add water let it hydrate in fridge, then just pull out a handful or whatever amount you need for that day. Easier than making it up everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Es Bee

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth buying!
customer_reviews.text: It is hard researching everything that is good for my tortoise friend and what is harmful. Then some things are only good in moderation. It is only a guess if he is getting the nutritional value he needs. This product gives me piece of mind I am providing the very best diet with confidence. RayBee took to the flavor without hesitation and enjoyed it. If you love your turtle as I love mine, you will give them this meal and know it is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Welby

customer_reviews.title: Tortoises Give It 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 5 tortoises have been forced to come to love this stuff. They were, at first, skeptical and picky. You know how these little monsters can be - smelling everything and turning their noses at new stuff. I soaked it in water and tossed their greens in it which made them eat it. After a short while they came to really love it and would eat the soaked pellets all by themselves, sometimes picking them out of their greens.
customer_reviews.author: azSherry

customer_reviews.title: Tortoise approved!!
customer_reviews.text: My desert tortoises really enjoy this food. The pieces are a little large but they manage. You should wet it so it is softer and easier for them to grab and bite. The directions on the container say to wet the food. It is low in protein and that is important for desert tortoise. My tortoises do browse in the yard for the most part, but I do like to supplement them with this especially before they get ready for hibernation.
customer_reviews.author: meohmy

customer_reviews.title: Desert tortoise won’t eat this at all!
customer_reviews.text: My desert tortoise has no interest in eating this product. I moistened it, tried mixing it with other food items, and he just walks over it, ignoring it. I don’t recommend this for desert tortoises. I had high hopes for this, but was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Snake Jagger

customer_reviews.title: Great additive for balancing my Russian's diet
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an additive to my Russian tortoise's leafy greens diet. It helps with nutrition and extra fiber/roughage, and allows me to manage his weight without limiting the volume he eats every day. I soak the hay pellets in water and mix the mush in with the leafies, and he eats it right up!
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Base For Russian Tort
customer_reviews.text: I have a 30+ year old Russian tortoise female who absolutely loves this stuff! We use a combo of fresh organic greens and this mix to make sure that she always gets the nutrition she needs. During winter, it's a godsend. During the summer, she's grazing mostly outside.
customer_reviews.author: Kato2k

customer_reviews.title: Love all the vitamins in it for my tortoises
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this product for 10 years my tortoises that are now 10 years old I believe the vitamins that are in it has been very helpful to keep my tortoise is healthy I give it to them about twice a week works great they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Silber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food for a desert tortoise, and Amazon has by FAR the best price!
customer_reviews.text: My desert tortoise has been eating this food for 3 years now. It's a complete diet for him, and he loves it. It's very easy to serve him, and absorbs lots of water to make a tasty mash for him. 60 ounces lasts almost the whole season for him, and I'm blown away by the price here on Amazon. The vet where I used to buy it (why didn't I check Amazon first?!) charges $48, and I just paid $15.19 for it here. Nearly $33 cheaper and delivered right to me. Can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: DesertMom

customer_reviews.title: My Torts seems to like it!
customer_reviews.text: My tortoises didn't know what to think about this food at first, but they seem to like it now! Great price and glad they make it available in that size! All I do is add warm water and wait a few minutes for it to absorb and get light and fluffy, then sprinkle it on their plate and they eat it right up. Took them a while before they liked it, but now they go right over to it and eat it!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie White

customer_reviews.title: Sulcata Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old Sulcata devours this stuff as soon as she sees and smells it (it has a pleasant scent). I've only recently started using this food, so I can't speak to the long term effects, but the ingredients list is very much in line with my research of what should be a good baseline diet. For now, all I can say is that my tortoise loves it and it gives her great poops. 'course, she'll also devour dog poo if I let her... sigh.
customer_reviews.author: STCWMan

customer_reviews.title: Tort noms
customer_reviews.text: Orthos loves it, I put the pellets in hot water, wait for it to cool and give it to my tort, makes a slow tort move fast, he runs to it and eats it all up.
customer_reviews.author: Taco Tuesday

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Comes quickly, packaged and sealed tightly. You must ADD WATER TO THE PELLETS. And make sure they are not hard in the middle before you feed them to your tort. It should be a very sloppy "mush" in order for them to eat it (also smells a bit gross). If your tort doesn't like it try mixing the food with their favorite foods/treats. Mine took a very long time before he'd eat it alone. Torts can be picky, and they do have tastebuds! So give it some paitence and try it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: K H

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping he'd like them since it's the best ingredients of any of ...
customer_reviews.text: My tortoise wouldn't eat these. I was hoping he'd like them since it's the best ingredients of any of the products, but even after I soaked them and mixed them all the way up into his salad separated, he ate right around them. I'm crumbling in the Mazuri brand instead, even though the ingredients aren't quite as good, because at least he'll eat them. He's only three though, still a baby. I gave them to a friend with a full grown Sulcata; if she likes them I'll post an update.
customer_reviews.author: Kyla George

customer_reviews.title: Easy to serve to my tortoises
customer_reviews.text: My tortoises love this food, either soft after soaking in warm water, or dry after I pulse it in the food processor. I actually think they like it better dry. I wish that there was an non pellet version that I could just pour out of the jar for them. But in any case, they love it and my vet told me that they need to eat lots of hay products, so it's a win win!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: tortoise likes it, I think
customer_reviews.text: The pellets are too big for aa small to medium sized tortoise to swallow, I think (didn't ask her when she was small). She seems to like them now that she is about 40 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Sangster

customer_reviews.title: It took some creativity to get our tortoise to eat ...
customer_reviews.text: It took some creativity to get our tortoise to eat this food, but now he loves it. We had to mix the moistened food in with his regular greens and flowers. Once he got a taste for it, he ate it readily, but it did take a couple of weeks for him to get a taste for it.
customer_reviews.author: Eastern Hound

customer_reviews.title: Moldy after winter.
customer_reviews.text: Our tortoise is awake, opened container to feed him, full of mold. Not the same product it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: MrVegasRN

customer_reviews.title: Good Supplemental Food
customer_reviews.text: As weeds and grasses die out in the summer months (for the most part) I supplement my Sulcata's diet with Zoo Med to make sure it's as balanced as it can be. I do add more water for a higher moisture content and find it's easier to spread it over lettuce leaves so he's consuming all of it. I also make diced salads of fruits and veggies and will incorporate it into the medley, which he loves.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Smith

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: My tortoise likes this food. I mix it with other greens and wet it.
customer_reviews.author: Dorene

customer_reviews.title: Hunger tortoise
customer_reviews.text: A geat food, I use as additional to the daily spring mix fresh lettuce. Recommended for grassland tortoises.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Richardson

customer_reviews.title: great feed
customer_reviews.text: this feed was recommended by the reptile company we bought our tortoise from, our tortoise is doing well on it
customer_reviews.author: TMartin

customer_reviews.title: My desert tortoise loves it .
customer_reviews.text: great good diet for desert tortoises. he has been eating it for years..
customer_reviews.author: cool mom

customer_reviews.title: Baby sulcata not interested
customer_reviews.text: Our baby sulcata tortoise will not eat this.. we have tried soaking in water, mashing it up, sprinkling on his greens.. he wants nothing to do with it!
customer_reviews.author: Lorie

customer_reviews.title: Use it for my leos
customer_reviews.text: They are less then 1 year old so I soak them into warm water before I feed them. I also mix them in with Mazuri pellets, fresh greens and occasionally I add some pumpkin to the mix. The advantage of the Mazuri is that it is a bit more oily, but then it has more protein which is not good for my leos. I figure by mixing it all together they would get the best of both worlds. By getting it wet and "sticky" it is also a really good way to sneak in vitamins and calcium!
customer_reviews.author: juliette

customer_reviews.title: Hello
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy didn't like this. Not sure why. Nothing wrong with the product as far as I can tell. I'm giving it 5 stars because the product is good and the shipping was fast. Just our little guy likes the fruit better
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for box turtles
customer_reviews.text: It said good for box turtles to but the Pieces are huge and u have to soak it in water I was looking for dry food I could just keep down all the time this was not it I would have sent back but my son opened it 😞
customer_reviews.author: Christi Stanbery

customer_reviews.title: It's  Nice
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product but for some reason my 4 year old Sulcata tortoise doesn't care for it but I thank he's just picky
customer_reviews.author: Bobbyjospain

customer_reviews.title: As described. Grassland tortoise food.
customer_reviews.text: Everything as described. My Hermans is being picky and does not eat it all the time though. I do crush it down and moisten it for the tortoise.
customer_reviews.author: RegularJoe

customer_reviews.title: Sulcata go-to food
customer_reviews.text: My sulcata loves this and I'm happy that this is the closest commercial food I can find on the market to their natural diet. This is a staple in the winter when grazing is not available. Very satisfied with this product and will not cause any pyramiding of the shell due to the minimal protein content - it's literally just grass which is the best thing for these guys.
customer_reviews.author: CapeSurfer

customer_reviews.title: Just another picky eater.
customer_reviews.text: I saw sooo many wonderful reviews about other picky eaters liking these pellets but Michelangelo won't eat it. I've tried mixing with water, with tortoise salad dressing, with fruit/veggie juice I prepare and hiding it in his food and he eats around it. He cracks me up! I am constantly surprised by my little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy B.

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive product
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this as I did for my Sulcata. A foil bag arrived with a Kyoto’s Co. and Hikari co Label. The first ingredient is fish meal, with all sorts of additives. I think I got the old switch a roo. Not taking a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Azmyk

customer_reviews.title: This product doesn't work for me!
customer_reviews.text: My turtle refuses to eat it! She's not a fussy eater at all - eats every kinds of appropriate greens with relish.... but this stuff, which my vet recommended, she HATES. Tried it several times, at different feedings - even tried to put tomato sauce on it, like the vet recommended. She ate the sauce off of it, and left the mushy pellets. I feel I wasted my money, and I'm seriously considering taking the company up on their guarantee of money back if not satisfied. I'm sure it's a great product, for most desert tortoises, but my little Russian turt wants no part of it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Smernoff

customer_reviews.title: I gave it four stars because a Sulcata Tortoise website said not to feed your tortoise any manufactured foods but this food seem
customer_reviews.text: This food comes in pellets that you moisten with water so that your tortoise can eat it. I gave it four stars because a Sulcata Tortoise website said not to feed your tortoise any manufactured foods but this food seems to be the same ingredients as recommended by the website. My son's Sulcata ate it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Haiku Wahine

customer_reviews.title: Tortoises love it,it helps them get their vitamins
customer_reviews.text: Awesome my tortoises love it.just get it a little wet but not too wet
customer_reviews.author: Tina B.

customer_reviews.title: Not easily eaten
customer_reviews.text: For some reason these pellets were alot harder for my turtle to eat. Even soaking it in water didn’t help
customer_reviews.author: Buglady

customer_reviews.title: My redfoots dig it!
customer_reviews.text: My redfoots like this as much as they like Mazuri - I still use both! I like that this food contains probiotics and is dried, compressed grasses, weeds, and fruits. It's a bit more natural than other processed foods. I started my tortoises on this when they were hatchlings and they gobble it up, but adults may be apprehensive with the first few introductions to this food. I use this as a supplement to feeding, once every week or two.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: My tortoise finally eats it
customer_reviews.text: My young tortoise didn't eat this for the longest time, but finally it is his primary diet. Be patient and keep trying. Very satisfied and recommend for all.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Gaffud

customer_reviews.title: I trust no other product!!
customer_reviews.text: Mazuri is, unfairly in my opinion, the heralded choice for tortosies and I can't see why, it is chock full of cereals and grains and has almost NO long stem grasses or anything close to what a tortoise would eat. This food is basically compressed roughage and grass. It is, to me, the best and ONLY choice for a tortoise to eat. I've fed it to my tortoises for over 3 years and they've grown magnificently.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Watkins

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOOD FOR GOPHER AND SULCATA TORTS
customer_reviews.text: I started out with a rescued sulcata tortoise the size of the pslm of my hand. I've had him on this grassland for several years and he is now as big around as a large dinner plate with No pyramiding. I also rescue gopher tortoises as a lic rehabber and they recover wonderfully on this.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Tortoise likes them
customer_reviews.text: My tortoise seems to really like these. The pellets are about .5 inch long.
customer_reviews.author: fand4

customer_reviews.title: She likes the food!
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to please tortoise, she like the food. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: This is the next best thing. Best thing is once the pellets have ...
customer_reviews.text: Our tortoises are kept in a homemade plexiglass home, so they don't get to forage. This is the next best thing. Best thing is once the pellets have been moistened, they dry out in more natural grass form and the tortoises love going back for seconds later.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the fresh vegetables
customer_reviews.text: This is nice product with minimal soy and lots of grasses that my tortoise needs. Just remember to add a little water so it falls apart. I put this in a ziploc bag and then shake it with the greens I give my tortoise so she eats it. At first when it was on the side, she wouldn't touch it. Now I mix it with everything else and she loves it. It is also a good value compared to the smaller containers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Collins

customer_reviews.title: I think it is a good way to get extra fiber into his diet when ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars but my tortoise wont eat it unless I mix it into canned pumpkin. I freeze canned pumpkin in ice cube trays and mix three hydrated pellets into one defrosted ice cube sized chunk of pumpkin. I think it is a good way to get extra fiber into his diet when greens are not available.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: someone please have a talk with my tortoises...
customer_reviews.text: No matter how hard I try I can't seem to trick my Russian Tortoise or my Sulcata Tortoise to eat this. I really like the idea of this stuff but it seems kind of pointless for me to buy it if I can't convince at least one of them to eat it. It seems like it is good quality stuff so I won't give it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Unbelieveable!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this product, I had no clue they made it in this size and was quite skeptical of its advertised size-especially since the cost was very close to what I paid for one that was less than 1/4 the size at a pet store! It got here and my eyes popped out of my head!! My Sulcata will not be running out of this anytime soon at all (I mean at least 2-3 years!)
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Tortoises love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried other tortoise food and our two red foots don't like them. They love this food. I feed this and fresh fruits and vegetables along with calcium and vitamin supplements. I can not say if this is a good food if it was the only thing you feed or not.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great value tortoise food!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 tortoises. They love this stuff. Vet recommended. One had a beak/jaw wound. We soaked the bits in water and once softened he ate it right up! On our 3rd purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lori S

customer_reviews.title: Frank says he loves these.
customer_reviews.text: Frank says he likes his rehydrated tortoise grass pellets shaped into a ridged line for easier chomping. His human providers comply.
customer_reviews.author: David Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great treat for your tortoise !
customer_reviews.text: My baby sulcatas love these ! They eat and snack on a pile of this throughout the day and it does take a couple of attempts to get them to try but when they do they love it
customer_reviews.author: DeadSpaceGrave

customer_reviews.title: Something new for my tortoise
customer_reviews.text: Something new for my baby tortoises and going see the difference from my other brand
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: My tortoise hates this
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly my tortoise might be picky, but she will not eat this food, even if I wet it and mix it with her greens. She will eat around any food that has this on it, making it totally useless for me. Maybe it's a good food, I don't really know but I do know that for me it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Shores

customer_reviews.title: Sulcata LOVE it, almost more than fresh Timothy
customer_reviews.text: We feed this as a supplement to our baby Sulcata Tortoises when we can't get fresh Timothy Hay and they both LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: BrewCityMusic

customer_reviews.title: However one month later both of my Tortoises are healthy and have a good appetite.
customer_reviews.text: Add water & mix it with some type of grass or for a treat some type of veggie... One will have to mound it back up at times as they will walk over it and mash the mix down. However one month later both of my Tortoises are healthy and have a good appetite.
customer_reviews.author: Drago

customer_reviews.title: The torture liked it
customer_reviews.text: She likes it very much the little grandkids can feed it to fluffy by hand
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Complete nutrition!!!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this brand for years now a mainstay in Tito’s diet.
customer_reviews.author: rickeevee

customer_reviews.title: If you have a desert tortoise this is the food you should be feeding them
customer_reviews.text: Great tortoise food! Full of the nutrients they need. This is my first time buying it from Amazon, but so much cheaper, for the same brand, then the pet store.
customer_reviews.author: TammyinMaui

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently brought a little girl Russian Tortoise into my home. I was worried she might be picky and not like this food so I bought the 15oz jar of this product but she seems to love it! I moisten a few pellets with spring water which makes them soft and fall apart for easy consumption. What's also great about this product is that it's high in fiber. I will definitely be ordering more when I run out!
customer_reviews.author: PomPomGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great for native tortoises
customer_reviews.text: I get this pellet food for my native desert tortoise. She loves the taste and it has 100% complete nutrition for her species. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: fannylovewonder

customer_reviews.title: Highly rated by other tortoise owners. Trying to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Highly rated by other tortoise owners. Trying to get my gal interested in it. Will be ordering more for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can't store it for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Good product, I'll buy again - but I bought 3 right before my tortoise went into hibernation; I unsealed one 9 months after purchase, and it was full of mold. I had to throw out 2 jars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sikes

customer_reviews.title: My tortoise loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome food for my growing Sulcata! My vet recommended this food for my tortoise. She does get fresh food as well but this is great to have on a day to day basis to ensure she is getting all of her required nutrition levels. Zoo med really does their research and has made, in my opinion the best tortoise food out there. It's easy to make, just put a few pellets in a dish and add water then you have a happy tortoise!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah P.

customer_reviews.title: My fella won't eat it
customer_reviews.text: It looks like the same product I always use for my tortoise except it's a much larger container. However, my tortoise refuses to eat this. Even if I try to mix it with something fresh, he will eat around it. I don't know what changed.
customer_reviews.author: LYNN K.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of prep
customer_reviews.text: Tiny pellet blocks that torts refuse to eat. I guess if hungry enough they would.
customer_reviews.author: Verified

customer_reviews.title: "Good Stuff!"--Tortoise
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's tortoise just loves this all-natural food. Spray it with reptile-safe water, and it's nice and mushy in just seconds. Another win for Amazon: once for ounce, this is less than half the price of the big pet food chain!
customer_reviews.author: Pete T.

customer_reviews.title: Forest Tortoise Pellets
customer_reviews.text: I give these as supplemental nutrition to my five year old yellow foot tortoise with his daily greens, fruits, and veggies. He LOVES them!
customer_reviews.author: AJ Lingle

customer_reviews.title: But if yours does like it, you get a good amoutn of food ...
customer_reviews.text: smells weird and my tortoise won't eat it. But if yours does like it, you get a good amoutn of food for the value
customer_reviews.author: Meowmerz

customer_reviews.title: Moldy in sealed container...
customer_reviews.text: I have not even opened the container yet and there is mold growing all over inside.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rudd

customer_reviews.title: Great, tortoises love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good food that has a good balance of nutrition for the tortoises. I've always supplemented their diet with fresh greens and vegetables, but this makes a good base. The torts love it, they come running when I put it out.
customer_reviews.author: TK421

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: My leopard tortoise loves this stuff mixed with peas and carrots. It really firmed up her poop as well so I know it's doing the job... TMI lol...
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: My turtle would not eat it. We tried whole ...
customer_reviews.text: My turtle would not eat it. We tried whole, soaked in water and even hammered it into a powder. He would rather not eat anything then food with this product on it.
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN FINCH

customer_reviews.title: My Tort Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My Redfoot Tort loves this stuff. I dont give this to her as her main source of food, but gives it to her every now and then and SHE LOVES IT.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Yun Park

customer_reviews.title: My sulcata tortoise loves this and its a good way to supplement his diet with grasses that are ...
customer_reviews.text: My sulcata tortoise loves this and its a good way to supplement his diet with grasses that are not readily available to us. We still give him fresh foods like chard, but I feel like these pellets make his diet more well-rounded.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Bugs
customer_reviews.text: Mine has bugs in it, not the kind tortoises eat.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket Queen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent food for your consideration. My African Spur loves it! No Pyramiding.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Tortoise food
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's a great product and each tortoise is different, but mine wouldn't touch it! We even tried to wrap it up in spring mix leaves and he ate everything around it and pushed it to the side. :/
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: is a great winter supplement of his diet when there is snow ...
customer_reviews.text: My African Leopard Tortoise loves this food, is a great winter supplement of his diet when there is snow covering the grass and he needs to be indoor.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Kettelhohn

customer_reviews.title: Add banana or other fruit for flavour
customer_reviews.text: My red footed loves it. If you mash a piece of ripe banana and mix it in, a picky tortoise may be more likely to eat it
customer_reviews.author: Mel B

customer_reviews.title: More nutrients.
customer_reviews.text: My tortoise has become accustomed to eating this when mixed with organic dandelion leaves, spinach, and berries. I feel better he is getting more nutrients from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elveeya

customer_reviews.title: my tort aint super picky, he'll take a few bites and walk ...
customer_reviews.text: my tort aint super picky, he'll take a few bites and walk away. takes him a while to finish a nice lump of the stuff.
customer_reviews.author: TheLegend27

customer_reviews.title: Not much to say. Our Sulcata enjoys this as ...
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. Our Sulcata enjoys this as a treat and break from the mountains of grass she consumes.
customer_reviews.author: C & T

customer_reviews.title: loves it
customer_reviews.text: my Tortoise loves this stuff i put a few pellets on a plate and moisten it up and feed it to him daily.I also wil sprinkle some calicum powder on it every few day as well
customer_reviews.author: Streetglide

customer_reviews.title: Easy to eat for yearlings
customer_reviews.text: Our sulcata LOVES this food. Easy to eat for yearlings, it smells almost fruity. Our tortoise loves these!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Adams OnlineTop Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: my tortoise won't eat it. I keep trying but no luck should I add water to it?
customer_reviews.author: Rena Sansone

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: I have been keeping and breeding tortoises for over 30 years. I've tried various packaged foods as supplements to a good quality varied diet of greens. Of all the brands out there the ZooMed Grassland (and Forrest) pellets have the best percentage and ratio of beneficial vitamins and minerals required for good growth and overall health. No junk, no fillers. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turtle food
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 15 oz size at my local pet shop for my tortise. He liked it and ate it up. This 60 oz size was so much cheaper than continuing with the smaller bottle. I just aded water and let it soak for a few minutes and feed it to my tortise.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Tonka loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Tonka the tortoise loves these. They're made of all the things he loves and gobbles them up every time we feed him.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I have never had this happen before but I received ...
customer_reviews.text: I have never had this happen before but I received this and it was moldy - the seal is in tack too.
customer_reviews.author: The Woodall's

customer_reviews.title: The turtles don't love it alone but when I mix it with water ...
customer_reviews.text: The turtles don't love it alone but when I mix it with water and put it over their greens, like dressing. They eat it
customer_reviews.author: Christine R.

customer_reviews.title: They dont eat them
customer_reviews.text: I have many varietys of torts. They'd smell em and walk away.

customer_reviews.title: Excelent food in past years
customer_reviews.text: Was not popular with my torties this year. Not sure why. Excelent food in past years.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. In addition to my Sulcatas dark greens,Bermuda Grass and Orchard Grass I include this product for nutrition and variety.

product_meta.title: Zoo Med Natural Tortoise Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Grassland| Size:60-OunceAt last, a natural long-stem fiber diet for Tortoises. Zoo Med is proud to announce the Natural Grassland Tortoise Food and the Natural Forest Tortoise Food. These new formulas contain long-stem fibers an important part of Tortoises natural diet. Only Zoo Meds new food contains this necessary fiber which is not found in any other commercial food. This new Natural food also contains nutritious Dandelion Greens, Yucca and other plants that tortoises love.
feature_bullets: Formulated for Russian, Greek, Sulcata, Leopard and Pancake Tortoises.
